excerpt: what's up everyone we are back with a fresh round of stocks giant investors are buying this is where the 13f reports to the SEC get released to the public and we're then able to see what stocks the giant Rich Elites have been buying in the most recent quarter and what a better way to kick things off than with the infamous Black Rock the absolute largest asset management company in the entire world who being led by CEO Larry Fink when Black Rock Mak moves it absolutely affects the market and our favorite stocks in a big way so let's not waste any time we got to take a look here at the five largest stock purchases that they just made and I'll give you my own opinion on each one of them and I'll even rank them from best to worst to based on that opinion to make it a little more fun and interesting as well. purchase number one we have cr ticker symbol CR who Black Rock has been kind of slowly adding to over the past year but then just decided to go ham on it out of nowhere in Q2 increasing their position by over 1,000% bringing the stake up to about $2.7 billion and and yet that's still only worth 0.06% of the entire stock portfolio that's how incredibly large black rock is anyway. it really is just the type of company that you would probably expect a giant like Black Rock to invest in because of how Dependable that business can be. plus keep in mind Black Rock plays a huge role in construction and overall development to many parts around the world so I have a feeling that they're very knowledgeable about what this company does and the market they operate in so it's just kind of a no-brainer for them to be investing in it too. I do think that black rock might be betting on CR here to potentially see a surge in demand hence why they're buying up the stock so heavily or at least so much heavier uh this latest quarter. moving on to purchase number two uh we actually have another gigantic increase here with a stock that I've never covered before on the channel and that is GE vnova ticker symbol gev which Black Rock increased by over 419,000 per. I'm guessing Black Rock had some type of early stake probably from owning GE I'm guessing which gave them some gev shares you know perhaps and then uh they probably just decided to increase that position by a large amount this last quarter which I don't blame them on. to the third purchase well we actually have another Energy stock except this one is a lot heavier into oil and gas although they are investing more heavily into Renewables recently too but that is of course Exxon Mobile ticker symbol XOM which they increase their position on by adding over 30 million more shares bringing the stake up to almost $35 billion. Moving on to purchase number four though uh oh yeah easily my favorite of the entire list here that's for sure in the giant Mighty Amazon ticker symbol amzn which they added another 10 million more shares of bringing the stake up to over $125 billion and worth uh 2.8% of the entire portfolio. that is of course the mighty Microsoft ticker symbol msft which Black Rock added another nearly 8 million more shares of this past quarter bringing the stake up to nearly a quarter of a trillion dollars at over 5% of the portfolio. overall I think it's a pretty interesting quarter by Black Rock obviously we expect them to keep adding to dominant winners like Microsoft and Amazon but the heavy additions in to construction and especially energy do look interesting and I can't really fault them for any of those pickups there either even though my moves would have been a little different I think there are better Alternatives but that's just my opinion anyway.

purchase number one we have cr ticker symbol CR who Black Rock has been kind of slowly adding to over the past year but then just decided to go ham on it out of nowhere in Q2 increasing their position by over 1,000% bringing the stake up to about $2.7 billion and and yet that's still only worth 0.06% of the entire stock portfolio. if you've never heard of CR well they're actually a very large building materials company and one that I've actually been keeping an eye on myself these past couple years because I really like how strong and dependable their business excuse me will likely always be as they mostly serve the construction and Manufacturing sectors providing things like Granite Limestone Sandstone cement concrete asphalt and more plus they offer services for these areas like construction pavement and many other things too. it really is just the type of company that you would probably expect a giant like Black Rock to invest in because of how Dependable that business can be and how much the world will likely always um need them right. which benefits CR greatly as they already hold more market share uh leader positions than really anyone else in both north North America and Europe with even more locations spanning across about 30 different countries worldwide. The results being that their financials are pretty strong with the only dips occurring during times of macroeconomic slumps that are mostly out of their control anyway like the 2020 lockdowns where so much of the world was of course forced to shut down but soon after they recovered to new record highs and are still expected to post mid singled digigit increases to revenue in each of the next two fiscal years. One concern I do have though is our high interest and mortgage rates that do tend to discourage lending and spending on big projects that would normally benefit CR however so far it hasn't really affected them as far as I can tell in a very big way. I do think that black rock might be betting on CR here to potentially see a surge in demand hence why they're buying up the stock so heavily or at least so much heavier uh this latest quarter of course a lot of this is still speculation though and I still think that a recession is not off the table for the macroeconomy so it may not be the safest stock to buy at the moment I'm personally holding off on it myself but I can see why others want to be buying it for their portfolios especially when the valuation is slightly cheaper than the sector with also a low payout ratio for their dividend that yields 1.8% despite the stock trading near a record high. I I will just say though that stock has dipped at many times in the past and for me the company really is a bit too low growth for my taste with also too low of a dividend yield to really get me excited enough to buy in near a record high stock price if it was dipping I would probably buy some but for now it's kind of a soft pass for me I'll still give it a pretty good ranking though here I'll put it in the middle at number three until we see what else is on this list. hard to rank this one though putting it up against CR but I think I'd give the slight edge here to CR just because it'd give me more exposure to or I should say any exposure to something new in my portfolio as opposed to just having another Energy stock so I'll bump them up one spot to put gev in at number three.

moving on to purchase number two uh we actually have another gigantic increase here with a stock that I've never covered before on the channel and that is GE vnova ticker symbol gev which Black Rock increased by over 419,000 per. so I'm guessing it was a very small position that they increased on it uh bringing the stake up to over $3 billion now if you've never heard of GE Vern NOA well it's probably because they were just spun out recently from General Electric earlier this year so I'm guessing Black Rock had some type of early stake probably from owning GE I'm guessing which gave them some gev shares you know perhaps and then uh they probably just decided to increase that position by a large amount this last quarter which I don't blame them on you know gev does look very attractive from a business standpoint being heavily involved in the electric power industry worldwide doing everything from generating transferring converting storing manufacturing and even servicing everything to do with power and this includes practically all forms of it too gas solar Hydro more than a quarter of the world's entire capacity there for G Vern NOA but they also have both onshore and offshore uh wind generation which is expected to see a lot of growth by the way as the world expands into the oceans and starts to utilize all of that unused space and they even do nuclear as well so they really do it all and there's lots of potential for the future in several of these areas of course energy is a massive market and it'll see even more growth from Renewables too these aren't areas that I think will ever disappear so from that standpoint or at least not anytime soon so from that standpoint it is uh very attractive I would say to own gev stock and while Revenue growth is relatively low at the moment around a mid single digigit rate their profitability has shown huge improvements over the past couple years turning free cash flow positive this past year to and of course they're just getting started there which is why the valuation looks expensive on current ratios but on a more forward-looking peeg ratio well they're actually a bit cheaper than the sector 2 the price itself though is already up over 35% from IPO which I would actually be fine still purchasing some of that even at those levels however I already own NEX era energy who I happen to like a bit more and they also pay a nice dividend too so I don't plan on buying gev at the moment however I do think that it's a decent enough long-term stock overall hard to rank this one though putting it up against CR but I think I'd give the slight edge here to CR just because it'd give me more exposure to or I should say any exposure to something new in my portfolio as opposed to just having another Energy stock so I'll bump them up one spot to put gev in at number three.

moving on though to the third purchase well we actually have another Energy stock except this one is a lot heavier into oil and gas although they are investing more heavily into Renewables recently too but that is of course Exxon Mobile ticker symbol XOM which they increase their position on by adding over 30 million more shares bringing the stake up to almost $35 billion but got to be honest with you guys this one is even less appealing to me than gev as they are in my opinion not nearly as Diversified into Renewables as gev more so kind of just a huge player in oil and gas with number one market share in America according to mortar intelligence um probably also in like the top five worldwide I would say which is totally fine by the way I'm not knocking them for that oil is still very important these days and will continue to be for some time but I just think that there is probably more growth opportunities longer term in Renewables which again I own next era energy for that but even if I did go with a top you know like five oil producer I would actually prefer Chevron instead who still has a huge Market position it's number two in America but in my opinion they have better investments into Renewables notably the 10 billion dollars are spending through the next few years on green projects including carbon capture as well as hydrogen which could be another $1.4 trillion Market Opportunity by 2050 and Chevron already has the largest hydrogen storage plant in the entire world that both stores and uses it to produce electricity I will say though Exxon is doing some impressive work with carbon capture but the stock is already up to a record high while Chevron actually dipped this past year leaving them with not just a cheaper valuation but also a higher dividend too so I just think there's some better options out there and I'm going to put Exxon at the bottom for now because of it all right.

but even if I did go with a top you know like five oil producer I would actually prefer Chevron instead who still has a huge Market position it's number two in America but in my opinion they have better investments into Renewables notably the 10 billion dollars are spending through the next few years on green projects including carbon capture as well as hydrogen which could be another $1.4 trillion Market Opportunity by 2050 and Chevron already has the largest hydrogen storage plant in the entire world that both stores and uses it to produce electricity I will say though Exxon is doing some impressive work with carbon capture but the stock is already up to a record high while Chevron actually dipped this past year leaving them with not just a cheaper valuation but also a higher dividend too so I just think there's some better options out there and I'm going to put Exxon at the bottom for now because of it all right.

Moving on to purchase number four though uh oh yeah easily my favorite of the entire list here that's for sure in the giant Mighty Amazon ticker symbol amzn which they added another 10 million more actually dipped 15% this past month leaving it trading near the same levels it did all the way back 4 years ago and that had to do with earnings that just missed analyst expectations because of lower average selling prices from their online store given the weak economy where people are just choosing to buy cheaper products but that's a ridiculous excuse really to be selling the stock guys this is just another example here of investors Being Greedy because if you'd actually look into the report you'd see that the numbers were outstanding for their size and by the way I love to buy a stock that's falling because of really no fault of their own Amazon isn't doing anything wrong it's just the macro environment that they're operating operating in but from their own singular business most profitable segment is now making up close to a fifth a fifth of the uh company's entire business and despite it already holding number one market share in the world well they still grew by almost and yet are still growing by 12% I mean that's unbelievable and even crazier than that look at their profits now they are uh really barely starting to put any emphasis on them yet free cash flow what already up to over $52 billion on growth of 572 guys name me one company in the world that is doing over 52 billion in profits and that increased it by like almost seven times larger year-over-year it's incredible it can't be matched really so when I get comments from people saying that Amazon is a bad stock to invest in I just want to show them a single screenshot like that and see what possible reaction a bear could have to that because it's mind-blowing numbers anyway the company is on fire and they still have many ways to grow even more in the future especially on the bottom line so with the market cap at like half the size of Nvidia and apple who I actually think they should be worth more than either one of those well I like the stock even here and I've been a buyer myself it easily gets the number one spot. I don't like the valuation though quite as much as Amazon at the moment so I'm giving Amazon the very slight edge here and keeping them at number one.

with that said though we do have just one more purchase here to run through and that happens to be not only the largest holding of the five but it's not the largest for for their entire portfolio but however I already own NEX era energy who I happen to like a bit more and they also pay a nice dividend too so I don't plan on buying gev at the moment. I just think that there is probably more growth opportunities longer term in Renewables which again I own next era energy for that.
